mechanics.mana_system: No mana system - cards have levels/ranks and summoning conditions
mechanics.color_system: Attributes: DARK, LIGHT, EARTH, WATER, FIRE, WIND, DIVINE
mechanics.special_rules: Going first advantage (55-60% win rate). Hand traps (9-15 in modern decks). Starter vs Extender theory. One-card combos.

terminology.Hand Trap: Monster that can be activated from hand during opponent's turn
terminology.Starter: Card that initiates combo (11-13 copies for 82-91% consistency)
terminology.Extender: Card that provides resources during combo

archetypes.name: Combo
archetypes.strategy: Establish unbreakable board turn 1, win through combo
archetypes.typical_curve: Low - focus on starters and extenders

archetypes.name: Control
archetypes.description: Reactive deck that wins through resource advantage
archetypes.strategy: Disrupt opponent, accumulate resources, win with finisher
archetypes.typical_curve: Medium - focus on disruption and value

formats.name: Advanced
formats.rotation_schedule: No rotation - only ban list changes
ban_list: Many cards - see official ban list
formats.meta_context: Dracotail, Maliss, Ryzeal, Yummy are top decks. Going first advantage (55-60%). Hand trap density 9-15.

examples.reasoning: Both are Blue-Eyes monsters. Alternative is alternative summoning condition version. Similar function in Blue-Eyes decks.
Both are hand traps. Ash Blossom negates searches/summons, Infinite Impermanence negates effects. Similar function, different targets.

temporal_context.current_meta: Dracotail, Maliss, Ryzeal, Yummy are top decks. Going first advantage 55-60%.
temporal_context.price_volatility: Ban list updates cause price spikes. Meta shifts affect card values
